subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.1 ant script on a Mac?
msgSnippet: Hi David, I just downloaded junit4.1.zip, extracted it, extracted the src.jar, and ran the default target for the build.xml. I didn t get the same error as the
messageBody:
Hi David,

I just downloaded junit4.1.zip, extracted it, extracted the src.jar,
and ran the default target for the build.xml. I didn't get the same
error as the OP for the ticket you linked to but I did get a test
failure. I proceeded to do a "ant clean" and re-ran the default target
getting the same test failure.

Below is the output from running those commands:


lkoskela@MACDONALDS:~/junit-1533332 $ uname -a
Darwin MACDONALDS.local 8.7.1 Darwin Kernel Version 8.7.1: Wed Jun 7
16:19:56 PDT 2006; root:xnu-792.9.72.obj~2/RELEASE_I386 i386 i386

lkoskela@MACDONALDS:~/junit-1533332 $ java -version
java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-112)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-64, mixed mode, sharing)

lkoskela@MACDONALDS:~/junit-1533332 $ ant -version
Apache Ant version 1.6.5 compiled on January 14 2006

lkoskela@MACDONALDS:~/junit-1533332 $ ant clean
Buildfile: build.xml

[delete] Deleting directory /Users/lkoskela/junit-1533332/junit4.1
[delete] Deleting 342 files from /Users/lkoskela/junit-1533332

On 8/3/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> All,
>
> Has anyone out there run the JUnit 4.1 build.xml script on a Mac? We're
> looking into
>
> http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1533332&group_id=15278&atid=215278
>
> and I wonder if anyone's seen the same problem, or if anyone's run the
> script without a hitch. Thanks!
>
> David Saff
